body:
Last step is to replace `Syncplay` with `SyncPlay`.

Also, the issue with the WebSocket messages won't be tackled in this PR, I guess.
Wrt the name, something that's not `Syncplay` might be a better choice, to avoid confusion with [the other Syncplay](https://syncplay.pl).
@ahti we had a several days long conversation internally and weren't able to come up with a name that most of the team liked... so we decided to stick to `SyncPlay`.

issue.title: Add syncplay feature
issue.body:
Related backend PR [jellyfin/jellyfin#2733](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/pull/2733).
Related web frontend PR [jellyfin/jellyfin-web#1011](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1011).

body: I cannot believe the timing, I've rebased again without noticing these requested changes. I swear I'm not doing this on purpose :sweat_smile:.

By no means interpret what I'm about to say as a blocker let alone a request. Just throwing out an idea to hopefully solve the bandwidth problem of group playback (CPU/GPU problem is solved with reproducible chunking).

Would client side p2p (likely via bittorrent) help with playback sync and distributing the bandwidth load for large groups? We have a web server that's exposed to all the clients already, so setting up a tracker and making sure its universally accessible is pretty easy.

A rudimentary non-bittorrent p2p might also make it easier to sync clients and server up depending on geographical layout of the members.
As long as P2P was an option and not a forced requirement. There are plenty of networks out there that block all P2P traffic entirely (many college campuses, for instance).

> Would client side p2p (likely via bittorrent) help with playback sync and distributing the bandwidth load for large groups?

It would, but
* can not be a hard requirement (some networks block P2P)
* should be done in a separate PR
* has limited use because different clients could be utilizing different streams of same media file (e.g. different versions or different transcode codecs or quality)
I don't think that should be an option. We shouldn't try to implement P2P functionality in clients for a single feature, even if it would be somewhat useful.

> By no means interpret what I'm about to say as a blocker let alone a request. Just throwing out an idea to hopefully solve the bandwidth problem of group playback (CPU/GPU problem is solved with reproducible chunking).
> 
> Would client side p2p (likely via bittorrent) help with playback sync and distributing the bandwidth load for large groups? We have a web server that's exposed to all the clients already, so setting up a tracker and making sure its universally accessible is pretty easy.
> 
> A rudimentary non-bittorrent p2p might also make it easier to sync clients and server up depending on geographical layout of the members.

That's [peertube](https://joinpeertube.org/) you're talking about. It works quite well, I'd be thrilled if some code could be shared (maybe as a plugin). Alternatively, something like [hypercore](https://hypercore-protocol.org/) could also be leveraged, but that might be less of a good fit :)

Edit: since federation is an often-requested feature as well, maybe a full peertube instance (I mean, something compatible with activitypub and webtorrent, that can federate with peertube, mastodon, etc) could be managed by jellyfin as a plugin?
SyncPlay and peer to peer are different features. It would be a shame to delay the merge of a nearly-completed feature because of a late scope extension.

> It would be a shame to delay the merge of a nearly-completed feature because of a late scope extension.

It was never getting delayed, we're just talking about future plans here. This will most definitely be in the next major release.
I am happy to test before release (so long as you can get me a docker) - been looking forward to this for a long while.
I believe `docker pull artiume/jellyfin:syncplay` should give you jellyfin with this feature.

> 
> 
> I believe `docker pull artiume/jellyfin:syncplay` should give you jellyfin with this feature.

Cheers, I will work out how to pull that and get it working with my existing install on unraid then feedback my experience.

idk where to post issues on this pull request, but I tried testing on artiume/jellyfin:syncplay docker and I'm having some trouble.  I made a new user, started playing something, started a group (which I didn't know you had to be playing something to create it but you definitely did say that in the initial message so that's on me I guess), then when I tried to join that group as the other user I just got a spinning wheel.  I am using a reverse-proxy and I just opened the group from the home menu without opening the file

Got this installed now - start a sync play group - how do I get another user to join?

Second user seems to be stuck at a loading wheel after hitting the button?

``` 
[00:59:51] [ERR] [28] Emby.Server.Implementations.HttpServer.HttpListenerHost: Could not find handler for /Syncplay/htmlvideoplayer/GetUtcTime
[00:59:51] [ERR] [28] Emby.Server.Implementations.HttpServer.HttpListenerHost: Error processing request: Unable to find the specified file. ```
Could be a cache issue, try opening the developer tools on your browser and navigating to the network tab, then selecting disable cache at the top.

> 
> 
> Could be a cache issue, try opening the developer tools on your browser and navigating to the network tab, then selecting disable cache at the top.

Tested without cache - not that.

As with the error message above, seems to be server side?

Error message in the jellyfin logs - incidentally, emby might need purging ;)

``` 
[05:36:21] [ERR] [9] Emby.Server.Implementations.HttpServer.HttpListenerHost: Could not find handler for /Syncplay/htmlvideoplayer/GetUtcTime
[05:36:21] [ERR] [9] Emby.Server.Implementations.HttpServer.HttpListenerHost: Error processing request: Unable to find the specified file.
 
```

We haven't renamed those classes yet for the same reason Emby never renamed half the projects from MediaBrowser to their new name. It would take a huge amount of effort to refactor, review, merge, and then fix all existing pull requests with the new name, whereas leaving them alone doesn't technically harm anything for now. Hopefully at some point in the future we can find the time though.

i haven't read everything carefully but if this p2p feature should be integrated (the part of the stream to be shared with others via the users) for watching at the same time then i have the question if the p2p is also encrypted???, otherwise you might get a letter or a visit from the police. here it would be great if it is also encrypted by default, if not you should be able to disable this on the server so that the stream is only sent from the server (preferably with a note in the setting that this is not encrypted when p2p is enabled)
The p2p is an expansion to this far down the line.  If we decide to go that route it will definitely need it's own discussion and considerations (encryption is one of those).

> 
> 
> i haven't read everything carefully but if this p2p feature should be integrated (the part of the stream to be shared with others via the users) for watching at the same time then i have the question if the p2p is also encrypted???, otherwise you might get a letter or a visit from the police. here it would be great if it is also encrypted by default, if not you should be able to disable this on the server so that the stream is only sent from the server (preferably with a note in the setting that this is not encrypted when p2p is enabled)

 Please do not fearmonger needlessly!

You will not get a visit from the police or a letter from your ISP, copyright theft claims are made by companies polling the bit torrent tracker lists for IP addresses associated with torrent files which contain stolen content. 

The chances of you getting a letter or visit from the police is effectively nil in a home media server implementation (you are sharing your media with authorized users of your media centre only, there is no public list for them to query who is downloading what.) 

This is also basically undetectable anyway unless you are living in a dystopic nation state that is doing deep packet inspection, has a lot of spare money and a lot of spare time to chase people for something that is most likely going to be determined as legal anyway (sharing with family.)

It should however be encrypted anyway and this is supported by bittorrent protocols.

Implementations of web based torrenting already exist with projects like peer tube or bittorrent web which may be of use in implementing such a system in jellyfin.

Related to my error message above, anyone got any ideas?

Seems like the error was not just for me: https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/pull/2733#issuecomment-632877941

>

I had the same issue when I gave it a try. Btw that docker image is a month old now.

Hmm, @OancaAndrei do you have a docker build for testing handy?

Seems to be working very well indeed - not seeing any issues with NVENC accelerated encoding either which is fantastic!

Kudos, SonarCloud Quality Gate passed! [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=BUG) [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=BUG) [0 Bugs](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=BUG) [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=VULNERABILITY) [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=VULNERABILITY) [0 Vulnerabilities](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=VULNERABILITY) (and [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=SECURITY_HOTSPOT) [0 Security Hotspots](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=SECURITY_HOTSPOT) to review) [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=CODE_SMELL) [](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=CODE_SMELL) [10 Code Smells](https://sonarcloud.io/project/issues?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&resolved=false&types=CODE_SMELL) [](https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&metric=new_coverage&view=list) [0.0% Coverage](https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&metric=new_coverage&view=list) [](https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&metric=new_duplicated_lines_density&view=list) [0.0% Duplication](https://sonarcloud.io/component_measures?id=jellyfin_jellyfin&pullRequest=2733&metric=new_duplicated_lines_density&view=list) The version of Java (1.8.0_252) you have used to run this analysis is deprecated and we will stop accepting it from October 2020. Please update to at least Java 11. Read more [here](https://sonarcloud.io/documentation/upcoming/)
We have to draw the line somewhere, and I think after nearly 250 comments and 2 months this is good to merge. Any future feedback can be addressed in separate PRs.
@OancaAndrei thank you so much for your monumental effort and perseverance! I love this feature so  much already :heart:

issue.title: SyncPlay for TV series (and Music)
issue.body:
**Changes**
This PR aims at making SyncPlay more tv-series friendly, by adding new states that handle the transition between one episode and another.

Sketch of proposed internal states can be seen [here (diagrams.net file)](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10KGS5KHmL1f8YRSdycUmGYUzfkLUm9sD/view?usp=sharing).

`jellyfin-web` PR [here](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-web/pull/1945).
`jellyfin-apiclient-javascript` PR [here](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin-apiclient-javascript/pull/67).

**Features being tackled in this PR**
- [x] Sync play-queue
    - [x] UI improvements so users know what's going on
    - [x] Next item
    - [x] Previous item
    - [x] Stop
    - [x] Repeat mode
    - [x] Shuffle mode
    - [x] Sort items
    - [x] Edit playlist
- [x] Group-wait when one or more members of a group are buffering

**Proposed features for future PRs**
- Group join by PIN
- APIs for plugins
- Guest users access
- Bypass library access and parental rating
- Share the transcoding process with the members of the group
- Handle multiple tabs of same user (looks like `WebSocketController::SendMessage` sends messages only to the last active socket)

**Implemented features in merged PRs**
- Option to toggle feature for specific user [User edit > Media Playback > Syncplay access]
- Filter groups by library access and parental rating

**Features being implemented in [next PR](https://github.com/jellyfin/jellyfin/pull/4329)**
- WebRTC for peer-to-peer communication (time sync between devices on LAN)
- WebRTC chunks sharing between peers (using [p2p-media-loader](https://github.com/Novage/p2p-media-loader/tree/master/p2p-media-loader-hlsjs#p2p-media-loader---hlsjs-integration))
- Manually adjust delay and tweak sync properties
- Playback and Playlist Access Control
- Group types (public, invite only, private)

**Issues**
Fixes #3228.
Fixes #3734.
Fixes #4155.

body: @OancaAndrei and @joshuaboniface firstly thanks for this feature and it works great with web player. But web player lacks few options and features. Is it possible to have sync feature with external players like vlc/mx player?

Hi @itsboo07, have you considered [Jellyfin Media Player](https://jellyfin.org/posts/client-jmp/)?
Regarding VLC or MX Player, I've never looked into their plugin system. The first roadblock would be session handling and WebSockets as SyncPlay uses them to sync the devices.

Edit: if I may, I'd suggest joining one of the [available channels listed here](https://jellyfin.org/contact/) if you're looking for more specific help :)

@OancaAndrei thanks for responding... I did not try jellyfin media player as I use android device to watch videos or movies or series. And jellyfin media player isn't available for android(as of now I guess) . I tried integrated media player from client settings in android and sync Playback doesn't work their either.... Only in simple web player it works... But the web player has big subtitle fonts and some functions lacking.
